column4: hello, my networking is kind of blowing out periodically, is this a known problem ?
Wireless?
Perhaps a bad cable or nic?
I find that I have to bring down the interface and bring it up again to get it to work
I doubt it
can you just get a new ip? (dhclient)
like run that to see what happens ?
I'm finding that dhclient is broken
like when it drops, can you just type "sudo dhclient" and get a new ip?  If that is it, then it is a faulty cable/router/nic.  If it must be brought down then up, it is a driver problem / nic prolem
how is it broken?
it stop routing packets
I'm not a networking expert
the interface stays up but the connection is wacked out, down effectively
then type sudo dhclient, that will get you a new ip and reauthenticate you to the network
unfortunately that seems to be broken
then it is probably the cable / nic
serious ?
yep.  I've had bad cables do that to me before
I've been using this cable for years so this is a bit of a surprise to take
it's working fine right now
to be absolutely sure, take a live cd like knoppix or ubuntu edgy, then try to use the network card for a while, if it works fine, then it is the driver.
